Row.Text: Rearrange owned Great Works into potential Themes. Does not swap Great Works with other Civilizations and removes any Great Works already up for trade.
Rearrange Great Works into potential Themes. Swaps Great Works with other Civilizations and may put excess Great Works up for trade (if needed).
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.

Because you have founded a Religion, Citizens throughout your empire no longer value your former Pantheon. Pantheons with an empire-wide yield bonus will remain inactive until you convert a majority of Cities to your new Religion!

Because you have founded a Religion, Citizens throughout your empire no longer value your former Pantheon. Pantheons with an empire-wide yield bonus will remain inactive until you convert a majority of Cities to your new Religion!
[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]Building Modifier from 'We Love the King Day:' {1_Num}%
The great wealth brought back by your {1_UnitType} has led your empire to celebrate 'We Love the King Day' for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turns!
Your {1_UnitType} journeyed to a far-off land and discovered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]! Two copies of this Resource were given to you in honor of your patronage.

Your {1_UnitType} increased your Influence in {3_CivShortDesc} by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR], and reduced the Influence of all Major Civilizations known to the City-State by the same amount!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Cannot be selected until you have founded a Religion[ENDCOLOR]
{1_CityName} is the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of {@2_CivShortDesc}. You can send either [ICON_SPY] Spies or [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomats to this City.
{1_CityName} is your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. It is a high priority target for enemy [ICON_SPY] Spies.
{2_ResourceName:textkey} is now available in {1_CityName:textkey}! This increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building pre-Industrial Era Wonders in this city by {3_Num}%!
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_RELIGION] Religion
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Traits
[ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} is added per turn from [ICON_CAPITAL] Cities
[COLOR_CYAN]Your current Global and Strategic Monopoly Bonuses:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Their current Strategic and Global Monpoly Bonuses:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
Potential Strategic and Global Monopoly Bonuses:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
(Hover over Corporation Icon or Name for details.)
You control over 50% of the World's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR], and therefore have a Global Monopoly![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}

{3_CivName} {3_CivName: plural 1?controls; other?control;} over 50% of the World's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR], and therefore has a Global Monopoly![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}
{2_CivName} {2_CivName: plural 1?has; other?have;} a Global Monopoly on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]!

You [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]no longer have[ENDCOLOR] a Global Monopoly on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lost:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all owned Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all owned Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +20% [ICON_FOOD] Growth in all owned Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in all owned Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monopoly Bonus:[ENDCOLOR] +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in all owned Cities.

Used by powerful late-game Units and Buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Units gain +5 HP when Healing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Resource tiles.

Used by powerful mid-game Units and Buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Naval Units gain +1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Resource tiles.

Used by powerful late-game Units and Buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Units gain +5 XP after combat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Resource tiles.

Used by powerful Units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Units gain +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Resource tiles.

Used by powerful Units throughout the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Units gain +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength when defending.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Resource tiles.

Used to build terrifying weapons of mass destruction.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Strategic Monopoly Bonus (25%):[ENDCOLOR] Units gain +10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global Monopoly Bonus (50%):[ENDCOLOR] +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in all owned Cities.
You control over 25% of the World's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR], and therefore have a Strategic Monopoly![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}

{3_CivName} {3_CivName: plural 1?controls; other?control;} over 25% of the World's [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR], and therefore has a Strategic Monopoly![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}
{2_CivName} {2_CivName: plural 1?has; other?have;} a Strategic Monopoly on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]!

You [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]no longer have[ENDCOLOR] a Strategic Monopoly on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lost:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceHelp}

Global Resource Monopolies are achieved when you control over 50% of a Luxury or Strategic Resource. This value can exceed 100% if you produce more of a Resource than exists on the Map. More than one Civilization can, therefore, have a Global Monopoly (though this is quite rare).
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They have a Defensive Pact with someone![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]We have a Defensive Pact with them![ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE]You have already invested [ICON_GOLD] Gold in this building. This building's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production cost is reduced by {1_Num}%.
[NEWLINE]You cannot [ICON_GOLD] Purchase this Unit without {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {1_BuildingType}} constructed in the city.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Investing [ICON_GOLD] Gold in a Building reduces its [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production cost by {1_Num}%, or {2_Num}% if a Wonder.[ENDCOLOR]
Your soldiers found information worth {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science during the conquest of {2_Name}!
You have completed a Policy Branch! Choose a free technology...
You can choose an Ideology! Select your free technology...
You have adopted a Belief! Choose a free technology...
The birth of a {1_Resource:textkey} causes the city of {2_CityName:textkey} to enter "We Love the Empress Day", giving the city a +50% [ICON_FOOD] growth bonus!
The aquisition of {1_Resource:textkey} causes the city of {2_CityName:textkey} to enter "We Love the Empress Day", giving the city a +50% [ICON_FOOD] growth bonus!

The City of {1_CityName:textkey} wants {2_ResourceName:textkey}! Connecting that resource to your trade network will cause the city to enter "We Love the Empress Day," increasing its [ICON_FOOD] Growth rate by 50%!
This City is in "We Love the Empress Day", which increases [ICON_FOOD] growth!
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to go into "We Love the Empress Day", which increases [ICON_FOOD] growth!

If this City-State is more [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]afraid[ENDCOLOR] of you than they are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], you can take exact heavy tribute from them. Doing so will net you [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_PEACE] Faith, or [ICON_FOOD] Food, depending on the City-State being targeted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The amount you can exact in tribute is based on Game Speed and the Yield output of your Capital. Local Yields, like [ICON_FOOD] Food or [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, will be delivered to your Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_FearLevel}{2_FactorDetails}
Because you are burning their city to the ground, partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!
Because your captured city is being burned to the ground, friendly partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!
